intro: Mandirola × naegelia, commonly known as the hybrid mandirola, is a rare and ornamental plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is a cross between Mandirola and Naegelia, two genera that share similar botanical characteristics. The plant typically features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of pink, red, or white, which bloom in late spring or early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Due to its rarity and specific cultivation needs, it is often grown in botanical gardens and by experienced horticulturists.
